{{pp-blp|small=yes}} {{Use dmy dates|date=July 2013}} {{Infobox football biography |name = Divock Origi |image = Divock Origi (25273591916).jpg |image_size = 200 |caption = Origi warming up for [[Liverpool F.C.|Liverpool]] in 2016 |fullname = Divock Okoth Origi<ref>{{cite news |title = 2014 FIFA World Cup Brazil: List of Players |url = http://www.fifadata.com/document/fwc/2014/pdf/fwc_2014_squadlists.pdf |publisher = FIFA |format = PDF |page = 4 |date = 11 June 2014 |accessdate = 10 July 2014}}</ref> |birth_date = {{birth date and age|1995|4|18|df=y}} |birth_place = [[Ostend]], Belgium |height = {{height|m=1.85}}<ref name=RBFA/> |currentclub = [[Liverpool F.C.|Liverpool]] |clubnumber = 27 |position = [[Forward (association football)#Striker|Striker]] / [[Forward (association football)#Winger|Winger]]<ref>{{cite web |last1=Williams |first1=Sam |title=Origi on shining his light, wide role and being 'fuelled' for Everton |url=https://www.liverpoolfc.com/news/first-team/340067-divock-origi-liverpool-everton-derby-interview |publisher=Liverpool F.C. |accessdate=3 March 2019}}</ref><ref>{{cite web |last1=Carroll |first1=Sam |title=Divock Origi opens up on new left-wing role and why Liverpool should remain patient at Everton |url=https://www.liverpoolecho.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/divock-origi-opens-up-new-15911089 |website=Liverpool Echo |accessdate=3 March 2019}}</ref> |youthyears1 = 2001–2010 |youthclubs1 = [[K.R.C. Genk|Genk]] |youthyears2 = 2010–2012 |youthclubs2 = [[Lille OSC|Lille]] |years1 = 2012–2013 |clubs1 = [[Lille OSC|Lille B]] |caps1 = 11 |goals1 = 2 |years2 = 2012–2014 |clubs2 = [[Lille OSC|Lille]] |caps2 = 40 |goals2 = 6 |years3 = 2014– |clubs3 = [[Liverpool F.C.|Liverpool]] |caps3 = 58 |goals3 = 14 |years4 = 2014–2015 |clubs4 = → [[Lille OSC|Lille]] (loan) |caps4 = 33 |goals4 = 8 |years5 = 2017–2018 |clubs5 = → [[VfL Wolfsburg]] (loan) |caps5 = 31 |goals5 = 6 |nationalyears1 = 2010 |nationalteam1 = [[Belgium national youth football team|Belgium U15]] |nationalcaps1 = 2 |nationalgoals1 = 0 |nationalyears2 = 2010–2011 |nationalteam2 = [[Belgium national youth football team|Belgium U16]] |nationalcaps2 = 9 |nationalgoals2 = 1 |nationalyears3 = 2011 |nationalteam3 = [[Belgium national under-17 football team|Belgium U17]] |nationalcaps3 = 1 |nationalgoals3 = 0 |nationalyears4 = 2012–2013 |nationalteam4 = [[Belgium national under-19 football team|Belgium U19]] |nationalcaps4 = 19 |nationalgoals4 = 10 |nationalyears5 = 2014–2015 |nationalteam5 = [[Belgium national under-21 football team|Belgium U21]] |nationalcaps5 = 2 |nationalgoals5 = 0 |nationalyears6 = 2014– |nationalteam6 = [[Belgium national football team|Belgium]] |nationalcaps6 = 25 |nationalgoals6 = 3 |club-update = 10:02, 27 February 2019 (UTC) |ntupdate = 14 November 2017 (UTC) }} '''Divock Okoth Origi''' ({{IPA-all|diˈvɔk ɔˈkɔθ oˈrigiː|[[Kenyan English]]:|Divock Origi pronunciation.ogg}}; born 18 April 1995) is a Belgian professional [[Association football|footballer]] who plays as a [[Forward (association football)#Forward|forward]] for [[Liverpool F.C.|Liverpool]] and the [[Belgium national football team|Belgium national team]]. He is the son of former Kenyan professional footballer [[Mike Origi]].
Origi began his career at [[Lille OSC|Lille]], and scored on his professional debut for them in 2013. A year and a half later, he was signed for £10 million by Liverpool, who loaned him back to Lille for the [[2014–15 Ligue 1]] season.
Origi made his international debut for Belgium in 2014, and was part of their team which reached the quarter-finals of the [[2014 FIFA World Cup]], during which he became the youngest goalscorer in Belgian World Cup history.
==Club career==
===Early career=== Origi began his career playing football at [[K.R.C. Genk|Genk]]'s youth academy where he spent nine years before signing for [[LOSC Lille|Lille]] in May 2010, aged 15, after turning down an approach by [[Manchester United F.C.|Manchester United]].<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.liverpoolecho.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/origi-turning-down-manchester-united-10994105|title=Origi: Why turning down United and ending up at Liverpool was best thing for me|last=Doyle|first=Ian|website=liverpoolecho|access-date=2016-03-11}}</ref>
===Lille=== [[File:Divock Origi (LOSC Lille).JPG|thumb|left|358x358px|Origi playing for Lille in 2014]] On 24 January 2013, Origi was an unused substitute in Lille's 3–1 away win over [[Stade Plabennecois|Plabennec]] in a [[2012–13 Coupe de France|2012–13]] [[Coupe de France]] match.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.ligue1.com/ligue1/article/lacklustre-lille-held-at-home.htm |title=Lacklustre Lille held at home |date=2 February 2013 |publisher=Ligue de Football Professionnel |accessdate=5 February 2013 |archivedate=17 May 2014 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140517121120/http://www.ligue1.com/ligue1/article/lacklustre-lille-held-at-home.htm |deadurl=no |df=dmy }}</ref> Nine days later, he scored on his competitive debut for the senior Lille side, coming on as a substitute in the 69th minute for [[Ronny Rodelin]] and scoring to bring his side from 1–0 down against [[Troyes AC|Troyes]].<ref>{{cite web |language=fr |date=3 February 2013 |url=http://www.losc.fr/actualite-foot-lille/ligue-1/b-pedretti-origi-le-rayon-de-soleil-de-la-soiree |title=B. Pedretti : "Origi, le rayon de soleil de la soirée" |publisher=Lille OSC |accessdate=5 February 2013 |archivedate=17 May 2014 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140517154355/http://www.losc.fr/actualite-foot-lille/ligue-1/b-pedretti-origi-le-rayon-de-soleil-de-la-soiree |deadurl=yes |df=dmy }}</ref><ref>{{cite web |accessdate=5 February 2013 |date=4 February 2013 |url=http://www.futaa.com/football/article/divock-origi-scores-on-ligue-1-debut-for-lille |title=Divock Origi scores on Ligue 1 debut for Lille |author=Patrick Korir |publisher=Futaa.com |archivedate=17 May 2014 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140517121707/http://www.futaa.com/football/article/divock-origi-scores-on-ligue-1-debut-for-lille |deadurl=yes |df=dmy }}</ref>
===Liverpool=== On 29 July 2014, [[Premier League]] club [[Liverpool F.C.|Liverpool]] announced that they had completed a £10 million transfer for Origi, who signed a five-year contract but was immediately loaned back to Lille for the [[2014–15 Ligue 1|2014–15 season]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.liverpoolfc.com/news/latest-news/167369-reds-complete-origi-deal|title=Reds complete Origi deal|date=29 July 2014|publisher=Liverpool F.C.|accessdate=29 July 2014}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/0/football/28551650 |title=Liverpool sign Belgium striker Divock Origi from Lille for £10m |date=29 July 2014 |publisher=BBC Sport |accessdate=29 July 2014 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140729230536/http://www.bbc.com/sport/0/football/28551650 |archivedate=29 July 2014 |deadurl=no |df=dmy }}</ref>
====2014–15 season: Loan to Lille==== In his first match back in Lille, Origi scored his first goal of the new Ligue 1 season through a penalty against [[Stade Malherbe Caen|Caen]] to secure a 1–0 win for his side. This was after he had been brought down in the box by defender [[Dennis Appiah]], who was sent off by the referee towards the 70th minute.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www1.skysports.com/football/live/match/321521/report |title=Ligue report: Lille let off the hook |date=15 August 2014 |publisher=Sky Sports |accessdate=17 August 2014}}</ref>
On 11 December 2014, as Lille lost 0–3 at home to [[VfL Wolfsburg]] to be eliminated from the [[2014–15 UEFA Europa League group stage|UEFA Europa League group stage]], Origi had a penalty saved by [[Diego Benaglio]].<ref>{{cite news|last1=Holyman|first1=Ian|title=LOSC left high and dry by Wolfsburg|url=http://www.uefa.com/uefaeuropaleague/season=2015/matches/round=2000587/match=2014565/postmatch/report/index.html|accessdate=11 December 2014|publisher=UEFA|date=11 December 2014}}</ref> On 15 March 2015, Origi scored a [[hat-trick]] for Lille in a 3–0 league win against [[Stade Rennais F.C.|Rennes]].<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.espnfc.com/french-ligue-1/match/393429/lille-stade-rennes/report |title=Origi back with a bang in Lille win |publisher=ESPN FC |date=15 March 2015 |accessdate=15 March 2015}}</ref><ref>[http://www.ligue1.com/ligue1/feuille_match/79062 Lille 3–0 Rennais Match Report]</ref>
====2015–16 season==== [[File:Goal from Divock Origi (19128014363).jpg|thumb|right|333px|Origi (left) in action for [[Liverpool F.C.|Liverpool]] against the [[Thai Premier League All-Star Football|Thai All-Stars]] in 2015|285x285px]] On 11 July 2015, Origi was named in Liverpool's 30-man squad for their pre-season tour of Thailand, Australia and Malaysia. In his non-competitive debut for Liverpool, a pre-season friendly against [[Thai Premier League All-Star Football|Thai All-Stars]] on 14 July, Origi scored his first goal for the club in a 4–0 win.<ref>{{cite news|url= http://www.liverpoolecho.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/liverpool-fc-4-0-thai-stars-9656001|title= Liverpool FC 4–0 Thai All Stars: Origi nets debut goal as monsoon fails to dampen Reds' pre-season stroll|date=14 July 2015|newspaper=Liverpool Echo|accessdate=15 July 2015}}</ref>
His first competitive game for the team was on 12 September, replacing [[Danny Ings]] for the final sixteen minutes of a 3–1 loss at [[Liverpool F.C.–Manchester United F.C. rivalry|rivals]] [[Manchester United]].<ref>{{cite news|last1=McNulty|first1=Phil|title=Man Utd 3–1 Liverpool|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/34160795|accessdate=2 December 2015|publisher=BBC Sport|date=12 September 2015}}</ref> Origi scored his first competitive Liverpool goals on 2 December, a hat-trick in a 6–1 away win over [[Southampton F.C.|Southampton]] in the quarter-finals of the [[EFL Cup|League Cup]].<ref>{{cite news|title=Southampton 1–6 Liverpool|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/34918281|accessdate=2 December 2015|publisher=BBC Sport|date=2 December 2015}}</ref> Eleven days later, he scored his first Premier League goal, replacing the injured [[Dejan Lovren]] in the 79th minute and scoring an added-time equaliser from outside the penalty area for a 2–2 draw against [[West Bromwich Albion F.C.|West Bromwich Albion]] at [[Anfield]].<ref>{{cite news|last1=Dawkes|first1=Phil|title=Liverpool 2–2 West Brom|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/35018987|accessdate=13 December 2015|publisher=BBC Sport|date=13 December 2015}}</ref> On 14 February, he scored his second league goal against [[Aston Villa F.C.|Aston Villa]] in a 6–0 victory, only 27 seconds after replacing [[Daniel Sturridge]] in the second half; this was the fastest goal scored by a substitute that season.<ref>{{cite news|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/35515112|title=Aston Villa 0–6 Liverpool|date=14 February 2016|publisher=BBC Sport|last1=Sanghera|first1=Mandeep|accessdate=14 February 2016}}</ref>
On 7 April 2016, Liverpool manager [[Jürgen Klopp]] surprisingly started Origi ahead of Sturridge (the team's first-choice striker) during Liverpool's [[2015–16 UEFA Europa League knockout phase|Europa League quarter-final]] match against [[Borussia Dortmund]], Klopp's former side. Origi scored a vital away goal in [[2015–16 UEFA Europa League knockout phase#Borussia Dortmund v Liverpool|the 1–1 draw]]. Three days later, he scored two goals in a 4–1 win over [[Stoke City F.C.|Stoke City]] after coming on as a substitute to replace [[Sheyi Ojo]] at half-time.
====2016–17 season==== Origi was used predominantly as a substitute and cup player at the start of [[2016–17 Liverpool F.C. season|the 2016–17 campaign]]. He scored his first goal of the season on 23 August 2016 in a 5–0 [[2016–17 EFL Cup|EFL Cup]] win over [[Burton Albion F.C.|Burton Albion]].<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.dailymail.co.uk/sport/football/article-3755142/Burton-0-5-Liverpool-Divock-Origi-Daniel-Sturridge-Roberto-Firmino-score-EFL-Cup.html|title=Burton 0–5 Liverpool: Divock Origi, Roberto Firmino and Daniel Sturridge find the back of the net as Reds ease into EFL Cup third round|website=Daily Mail|last=King|first=Dominic|date=23 August 2016|accessdate=30 November 2016}}</ref> He scored his first [[2016–17 Premier League]] goal on 26 November, coming off the bench for the injured [[Philippe Coutinho]] to score the opener in a 2–0 win over [[Sunderland A.F.C.|Sunderland]].<ref>{{cite news|url=https://www.telegraph.co.uk/football/2016/11/26/premier-league-clockwatch-liverpool-vs-sunderland-rest-3pm-kick/|title=Liverpool 2 Sunderland 0: Divock Origi provides relief after Philippe Coutinho is stretchered off|website=Telegraph|last=Findon|first=Ben|date=26 November 2016|accessdate=30 November 2016}}</ref>
====2017–18 season: Loan to VfL Wolfsburg==== On 31 August 2017, [[Bundesliga]] club [[VfL Wolfsburg]] announced the signing of Origi on a season-long loan deal.<ref>{{cite news|url=https://www.vfl-wolfsburg.de/en/info/news/detailspage/artikel/welkom-divock-origi-47146.html|title=Welkom, Divock Origi! |website=vfl-wolfsburg.de|date=31 August 2017|accessdate=31 August 2017}}</ref><ref>{{Cite news|url=http://www.goal.com/en/news/liverpools-divock-origi-joins-wolfsburg-in-6m-season-long/13zpa1prlvhfw1k7zy6spcfxkw|title=Liverpool's Divock Origi joins Wolfsburg in £6m season-long loan deal {{!}} Goal.com|access-date=2018-06-13|language=en}}</ref>
====2018–19 season: Return to Liverpool==== On 2 December, Origi scored his first goal of the season in [[Merseyside derby|a derby match]] against city rivals [[Everton F.C.|Everton]], which Liverpool won 1–0. Origi came on as a substitute for [[Roberto Firmino]] in the 84th minute and scored with a header in the 96th minute, capitalising on an error from Everton goalkeeper [[Jordan Pickford]].<ref>{{cite news|url=https://www.liverpoolfc.com/news/first-team/328060-match-report-liverpool-everton|title=Origi saves the day{{!}}|date=2 December 2018|publisher=Liverpool F.C.|accessdate=2 December 2018}}</ref>
==International career== Origi has represented Belgium at [[Belgium national youth football team|under-15]], [[Belgium national youth football team|under-16]], [[Belgium national under-17 football team|under-17]], [[Belgium national under-19 football team|under-19]] and [[Belgium national under-21 football team|under-21]] level. He scored ten goals while in the under-19 team, the first in a [[2013 UEFA European Under-19 Championship qualification]] match against [[Belarus national under-19 football team|Belarus]] on 12 October 2012.
The [[Football Kenya Federation]] expressed an interest in persuading Origi to play for the [[Kenya national football team|Kenya senior national team]] in the future.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.goal.com/en-ke/news/4522/kenya/2013/02/04/3726151/kenya-fa-reveal-they-will-lure-striker-divock-origi-to-play?ICID=HP_MR_2 |title=Kenya FA reveal they will lure striker Divock Origi to play for Harambee Stars |date=4 February 2013 |first=David |last=Kwalimwa |publisher=Goal.com |accessdate=5 February 2013 |archivedate=8 February 2013 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20130208060847/http://www.goal.com/en-ke/news/4522/kenya/2013/02/04/3726151/kenya-fa-reveal-they-will-lure-striker-divock-origi-to-play?ICID=HP_MR_2 |deadurl=no |df=dmy }}</ref> However, on 13 May 2014, [[Belgium national football team|Belgium senior national team]] manager [[Marc Wilmots]] announced Origi would be part of the 23-man squad representing Belgium at the [[2014 FIFA World Cup]].<ref>{{cite news|url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/0/football/27395150 |title=Adnan Januzaj included in Belgium's World Cup squad |date=13 May 2014 |accessdate=13 May 2014 |publisher=BBC Sport |archivedate=1 July 2014 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140701141133/http://www.bbc.com/sport/0/football/27395150 |deadurl=no |df=dmy }}</ref>
Origi came on as a substitute for [[Romelu Lukaku]] in the 58th minute of the opening [[2014 FIFA World Cup Group H|Group H]] game against [[Algeria national football team|Algeria]] in [[Belo Horizonte]] on 17 June. In Belgium's second match, again after coming on as a substitute for Lukaku, he scored his first senior international goal in the 88th minute of a 1–0 win over [[Russia national football team|Russia]] to qualify the ''Red Devils'' for the [[2014 FIFA World Cup knockout stage|knockout stage]].<ref name=bbc>{{cite news|url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/0/football/25285242 |title=Belgium v Russia |first=Graham |last=Chase |date=22 June 2014 |accessdate=22 June 2014 |publisher=BBC Sport |archivedate=8 July 2014 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140708204715/http://www.bbc.com/sport/0/football/25285242 |deadurl=no |df=dmy }}</ref> In so doing, at 19 years, 2 months and 4 days, he became the youngest goalscorer of the tournament (until [[United States national men's soccer team|American]] winger [[Julian Green]] scored against Belgium during their [[2014 FIFA World Cup knockout stage#Belgium vs United States|round of 16 match]]), the youngest goalscorer in Belgian World Cup history, and the first player of Kenyan origin to score at a [[FIFA World Cup|World Cup finals]].<ref>{{cite news|url=http://bleacherreport.com/articles/2105895-divock-origis-late-goal-for-belgium-defeats-russia |title=Divock Origi's Late Goal for Belgium Defeats Russia |publisher=Bleacher Report |first=Sean |last=Swaby |date=22 June 2014 |accessdate=22 June 2014 |archivedate=10 July 2014 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140710225439/http://bleacherreport.com/articles/2105895-divock-origis-late-goal-for-belgium-defeats-Russia |deadurl=no |df=dmy }}</ref> For his performances, he was named the Young Talent of the 2014 [[Belgian Sportsman of the year]] awards.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.goal.com/en-ke/news/4522/kenya/2014/12/16/7122662/origi-scoops-belgiums-award-for-most-promising-youngster|title=Lille loanee Divock Origi has won Belgium’s award for most Promising Youngster of the Year 2014 as Liverpool summer signing continues to impress|accessdate=2 December 2015|publisher=Goal.com|date=16 December 2014}}</ref>
Origi scored once in Belgium's successful [[UEFA Euro 2016 qualifying]] campaign, in a 6–0 home win over [[Andorra national football team|Andorra]] on 10 October 2014.<ref>{{cite news|last1=Chambers|first1=Miles|title=Belgium 6–0 Andorra: De Bruyne and Mertens bag doubles in record-equalling win|url=http://www.goal.com/en-gb/match/belgium-vs-andorra/1653181/report|accessdate=2 December 2015|publisher=Goal.com|date=10 October 2014}}</ref> He was included in the squad for [[UEFA Euro 2016|the final tournament]], but missed out on the [[2018 FIFA World Cup]].<ref>https://www.skysports.com/football/news/29908/11380541/radja-nainggolan-left-out-of-belgium-world-cup-squad</ref>
==Personal life== Origi was born in [[Ostend]] and grew up in [[Houthalen-Helchteren|Houthalen-Oost]].<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.nieuwsblad.be/article/detail.aspx?articleid=BLBOZ_01167498 |title=Mike Origi: 'Natuurlijk zijn we fier op Divock' |date=4 July 2014 |newspaper=Het Nieuwsblad |location= |accessdate=22 July 2014 |language=nl |archivedate=27 July 2014 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140727074127/http://www.nieuwsblad.be/article/detail.aspx?articleid=BLBOZ_01167498 |deadurl=no |df=dmy }}</ref> He was born into a family of footballers. His father, [[Mike Origi]], played for [[KV Oostende]] (at the time Divock was born) and Genk, among other Belgian clubs, as well as the Kenya national team. His uncle, Austin Oduor, played for [[Gor Mahia F.C.|Gor Mahia]] in the [[Kenyan Premier League]] while his other uncles, Gerald and Anthony, played for [[Tusker F.C.|Tusker]].<ref>[http://kenyafootball.com/index.php?doc=story&id=1033&categ=1 Mike Okoth Origi: The unsung grandmaster of Kenyan Soccer] {{webarchive |url=https://web.archive.org/web/20071006140034/http://kenyafootball.com/index.php?doc=story&id=1033&categ=1 |date=6 October 2007 }}</ref> His cousin [[Arnold Origi|Arnold]] currently plays for [[Lillestrøm SK|Lillestrøm]] in the Norwegian [[Tippeligaen]] and the Kenya national team as a [[Goalkeeper (association football)|goalkeeper]]. The Origi family is of [[Kenyans|Kenyan]] [[Luo people|Luo]] ethnicity.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.standardmedia.co.ke/worldcup/article/2000126369/divock-origi-proud-of-kenyan-heritage-speaks-kiswahili-and-four-luo-words|title=In footsteps of his father: Belgium star Divock Origi proud of Kenyan heritage, speaks Kiswahili and four Luo words|date=29 June 2014 |first=Robin|last=Toskin|newspaper=The Standard|location=Nairobi|accessdate=5 July 2014}}</ref>
On 25 June 2014, a baby dolphin at the [[Boudewijn Seapark]] in [[Bruges]] was baptised "Origi" in Divock Origi's honour after having scored the winning goal against Russia during Belgium's group stage match at the 2014 World Cup.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.rtl.be/info/votreregion/flandre/1103384/origi-debarque-a-bruges- |title=Origi débarque à Bruges! |language=fr |date=25 June 2014 |publisher=RTL Television |accessdate=28 June 2014 |archivedate=10 July 2014 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140710225210/http://www.rtl.be/info/votreregion/flandre/1103384/origi-debarque-a-bruges- |deadurl=no |df=dmy }}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://sporza.be/cm/sporza/voetbal/Rode_Duivels/1.2011524 |title=Dolfijntje "Origi" geboren in Boudewijn Seapark |language=nl |date=25 June 2014 |accessdate=22 July 2014 |publisher=Sporza |archivedate=26 July 2014 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140726202914/http://sporza.be/cm/sporza/voetbal/Rode_Duivels/1.2011524 |deadurl=no |df=dmy }}</ref>
==Career statistics==

{{reflist|group=lower-alpha}}

Retrieved 7 July 2017.</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://eu-football.info/_player.php?id=28641|title=Divock Origi – national football team player |publisher=eu-football.info|accessdate=6 September 2014}}</ref><ref group="nb">The friendly against [[Luxembourg national football team|Luxembourg]] on 26 May 2014 is not FIFA-recognised due to an excessive number of substitutions.</ref>
